Package view

Interface GUIView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JFrameViewImpl
    public interface GUIView
    This interface represents the controller that interacts with the model and the set of methods that can be called upon to interact with the model.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addFeatures​(Features feature)
      This method adds features to the components of the panel such as buttons and text fields.
      void buyAnotherReset()
      This method displays the previous view of buying stock.
      void displayAddStocksUsingDollarStrategyMain​(java.lang.String[] displayString)
      This method displays list of portfolios, date to be selected, recurring or non-recurring option that needs to be selected by the user.
      void displayBoughtSuccessfulAndWouldLikeToBuyAgainButtonWindow​(java.lang.String showSuccessMsg)
      This method displays the message when the stocks are successfully bought.
      void displayErrorMessage​(java.lang.String error)
      This method helps in displaying the error message if the user enters invalid input.
      void displayInformationalMessage​(java.lang.String info)
      This method helps in displaying informational message to the user.
      void displayListOfPortfolioScreen​(java.lang.String[] getListOfPortfolioNames)
      This method simply displays the list of portfolios to the user.
      void displayPerformanceNumberOfDaysInput​(java.lang.String str)
      This method displays the number of days/months/years received from the controller and prompts the user to enter on the basis of the available range.
      void displayPerformanceOfPortfolio​(java.lang.String[] displayString)
      This method prompts the user to select portfolio from the list of available flexible portfolios received from the controller and asks the user to select date as input.
      void displaySellScreen()
      This method displays the option to choose date and prompts the user to select the date of selling a stock.
      void displaySellScreen2​(java.lang.String[] listOfAvailableStocksForSale)
      This method views the list of options of stocks available for sale that are received from the controller and prompts the user to input the number of shares that the user wants to sell.
      void displayTypeOfPortfolioFlexibleOrInFlexibleScreen()
      This method gets the type of portfolio(Flexible or Inflexible), name of the portfolio from the user and asks the user to opt for buying or investing in the portfolio.
      void displayValueCompForCost​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String[] costData)
      This method displays the total money invested and the total number of transactions.
      void displayValueCompForOthers​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String[] column, java.lang.String[][] data, java.lang.String footer)
      This method displays the total composition of the portfolio.
      void dollarValueEndDateScreen​(java.lang.String str)
      This method prompts the user to select end date for the strategy.
      void dollarValueFrequencyEnterScreen​(java.lang.String str)
      This method helps in displaying the option to enter recurring frequency by the user
      void dollarValueHowManyStocksScreen​(java.lang.String buyStr)
      This method asks the user to enter the number of stocks that needs to be bought.
      void dollarValueOnGoingScreen()
      This method prompts the user to select if the strategy is ongoing or not.
      void dollarValueStockProportionScreen​(int numberOfStocks, java.lang.String[] supportedStocks)
      This method propts the user to select stocks and enter proportion.
      void flexiblePortfolioScreenWithDateInput​(int type, java.lang.String[] supportedStocks, java.lang.String name)
      This method views the user to select stocks from the supported list of stocks and date of purchase.
      void getGraph​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> pfPerformance, java.lang.String pfName)
      This method helps in displaying the graph of the performance.
      void inflexiblePortfolioScreen​(java.lang.String[] supportedStocks)
      This method prompts the user to select stocks from the supported list of stocks.
      int jOptionPortfolioAlreadyExists()
      This method pops up a dialog box to get input from the user if the user wants to override the portfolio or not.
      void performanceDateEnter​(int timestampType)
      This method views the date that needs to be selected by the user.
      void resetCreatePortfolioScreen()
      This method resets all the components of the Create Portfolio view.
      void resetDollarValueMainScreen()
      This method clears all the options of dollar value main screen.
      void resetFlexiblePortfolioScreen()
      This method resets all the components of the Flexible Portfolio View.
      void resetHowManyShares()
      This method clears the text field of number of shares.
      void resetMainMenu()
      This method clears all the options of the main menu screen.
      void resetStockSellScreenAfterSell()
      This method resets the list of stocks available for sale and the text field.
      void totalCostInvestedByDateScreenOne​(java.lang.String[] listOfPortfolioNames)
      This method prompts the user to select date and portfolio from the list of portfolios for COST Basis
      void valueAndCompFlexDateScreen()
      This method prompts the user to select date for displaying value and composition of flexible portfolio.
      void valueAndCompScreenInflexibleResult​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String[] column, java.lang.String[][] data, java.lang.String subText)
      This method displays the composition of inflexible portfolio.
      void valueAndCompScreenOne​(java.lang.String[] displayString)
      This method prompts the user to select portfolio.
      void valueOnFullCompScreenOne​(java.lang.String[] displayString)
      This method prompts the user to select date and portfolio from the list of portfolios for Full composition

    • Method Detail

      • addFeatures

        void addFeatures​(Features feature)
        This method adds features to the components of the panel such as buttons and text fields. It consists of collection of actionListeners of all the components and performs action based on the type of action provided.
        Parameters:
        feature - type of feature provided as per the component.

      • displayTypeOfPortfolioFlexibleOrInFlexibleScreen

        void displayTypeOfPortfolioFlexibleOrInFlexibleScreen()
        This method gets the type of portfolio(Flexible or Inflexible), name of the portfolio from the user and asks the user to opt for buying or investing in the portfolio. When the user selects to create portfolio, this is the first screen that gets displayed by the view.

      • jOptionPortfolioAlreadyExists

        int jOptionPortfolioAlreadyExists()
        This method pops up a dialog box to get input from the user if the user wants to override the portfolio or not.
        Returns:
        the override option selected by user

      • flexiblePortfolioScreenWithDateInput

        void flexiblePortfolioScreenWithDateInput​(int type,
                                          java.lang.String[] supportedStocks,
                                          java.lang.String name)
        This method views the user to select stocks from the supported list of stocks and date of purchase.
        Parameters:
        type - type of portfolio
        supportedStocks - list of available stocks supported by the application
        name - name of the portfolio

      • inflexiblePortfolioScreen

        void inflexiblePortfolioScreen​(java.lang.String[] supportedStocks)
        This method prompts the user to select stocks from the supported list of stocks.
        Parameters:
        supportedStocks - list of strings of supported stocks

      • displayPerformanceOfPortfolio

        void displayPerformanceOfPortfolio​(java.lang.String[] displayString)
        This method prompts the user to select portfolio from the list of available flexible portfolios received from the controller and asks the user to select date as input.
        Parameters:
        displayString - list of available flexible portfolios.

      • resetMainMenu

        void resetMainMenu()
        This method clears all the options of the main menu screen.

      • performanceDateEnter

        void performanceDateEnter​(int timestampType)
        This method views the date that needs to be selected by the user.
        Parameters:
        timestampType - timestamp selected by the user

      • displayErrorMessage

        void displayErrorMessage​(java.lang.String error)
        This method helps in displaying the error message if the user enters invalid input.
        Parameters:
        error - the error message received from the controller

      • displayInformationalMessage

        void displayInformationalMessage​(java.lang.String info)
        This method helps in displaying informational message to the user.
        Parameters:
        info - the informational message received from the controller.

      • displayPerformanceNumberOfDaysInput

        void displayPerformanceNumberOfDaysInput​(java.lang.String str)
        This method displays the number of days/months/years received from the controller and prompts the user to enter on the basis of the available range.
        Parameters:
        str - the valid range of date received from the controller

      • getGraph

        void getGraph​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> pfPerformance,
              java.lang.String pfName)
        This method helps in displaying the graph of the performance.
        Parameters:
        pfPerformance - the map of performance received from the controller.
        pfName - the portfolio name.

      • resetCreatePortfolioScreen

        void resetCreatePortfolioScreen()
        This method resets all the components of the Create Portfolio view.

      • resetFlexiblePortfolioScreen

        void resetFlexiblePortfolioScreen()
        This method resets all the components of the Flexible Portfolio View.

      • displayBoughtSuccessfulAndWouldLikeToBuyAgainButtonWindow

        void displayBoughtSuccessfulAndWouldLikeToBuyAgainButtonWindow​(java.lang.String showSuccessMsg)
        This method displays the message when the stocks are successfully bought.
        Parameters:
        showSuccessMsg - the message is sent from the controller.

      • resetHowManyShares

        void resetHowManyShares()
        This method clears the text field of number of shares. The reset of the text field takes place if the user tries to input wrong input. The instruction to rest the text field is given by the controller.

      • displaySellScreen

        void displaySellScreen()
        This method displays the option to choose date and prompts the user to select the date of selling a stock.

      • displayListOfPortfolioScreen

        void displayListOfPortfolioScreen​(java.lang.String[] getListOfPortfolioNames)
        This method simply displays the list of portfolios to the user.
        Parameters:
        getListOfPortfolioNames - the list of portfolio names is made available to the view by the controller

      • displayAddStocksUsingDollarStrategyMain

        void displayAddStocksUsingDollarStrategyMain​(java.lang.String[] displayString)
        This method displays list of portfolios, date to be selected, recurring or non-recurring option that needs to be selected by the user.
        Parameters:
        displayString - list of portfolios available sent by the controller

      • resetDollarValueMainScreen

        void resetDollarValueMainScreen()
        This method clears all the options of dollar value main screen.

      • dollarValueOnGoingScreen

        void dollarValueOnGoingScreen()
        This method prompts the user to select if the strategy is ongoing or not.

      • dollarValueEndDateScreen

        void dollarValueEndDateScreen​(java.lang.String str)
        This method prompts the user to select end date for the strategy.
        Parameters:
        str - the range of date received by the controller

      • dollarValueFrequencyEnterScreen

        void dollarValueFrequencyEnterScreen​(java.lang.String str)
        This method helps in displaying the option to enter recurring frequency by the user
        Parameters:
        str - the frequency range is determined by model and is sent by the controller to the view.

      • dollarValueHowManyStocksScreen

        void dollarValueHowManyStocksScreen​(java.lang.String buyStr)
        This method asks the user to enter the number of stocks that needs to be bought. If the frequency is invalid, the view displays an error message.
        Parameters:
        buyStr - the type of str to be displayed comes from the controller

      • dollarValueStockProportionScreen

        void dollarValueStockProportionScreen​(int numberOfStocks,
                                      java.lang.String[] supportedStocks)
        This method propts the user to select stocks and enter proportion.
        Parameters:
        numberOfStocks - the number of stocks
        supportedStocks - list of supported stocks

      • valueAndCompScreenOne

        void valueAndCompScreenOne​(java.lang.String[] displayString)
        This method prompts the user to select portfolio.
        Parameters:
        displayString - list of available portfolios.

      • valueAndCompScreenInflexibleResult

        void valueAndCompScreenInflexibleResult​(java.lang.String title,
                                        java.lang.String[] column,
                                        java.lang.String[][] data,
                                        java.lang.String subText)
        This method displays the composition of inflexible portfolio.
        Parameters:
        title - name of portfolio
        column - columns determining name, symbol, quantity, DOP, Price on DOP
        data - values of the portfolio coming from the controller
        subText - DOP value

      • valueAndCompFlexDateScreen

        void valueAndCompFlexDateScreen()
        This method prompts the user to select date for displaying value and composition of flexible portfolio.

      • displayValueCompForCost

        void displayValueCompForCost​(java.lang.String title,
                             java.lang.String[] costData)
        This method displays the total money invested and the total number of transactions.
        Parameters:
        title - cost basis of portfolio
        costData - the cost data value of the portfolio

      • displayValueCompForOthers

        void displayValueCompForOthers​(java.lang.String title,
                               java.lang.String[] column,
                               java.lang.String[][] data,
                               java.lang.String footer)
        This method displays the total composition of the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        title - name of portfolio
        column - columns such as name, symbol, quantity, share value, total value
        data - the share values
        footer - total portfolio value

      • valueOnFullCompScreenOne

        void valueOnFullCompScreenOne​(java.lang.String[] displayString)
        This method prompts the user to select date and portfolio from the list of portfolios for Full composition
        Parameters:
        displayString - list of portfolios

      • totalCostInvestedByDateScreenOne

        void totalCostInvestedByDateScreenOne​(java.lang.String[] listOfPortfolioNames)
        This method prompts the user to select date and portfolio from the list of portfolios for COST Basis
        Parameters:
        listOfPortfolioNames - list of portfolios

      • displaySellScreen2

        void displaySellScreen2​(java.lang.String[] listOfAvailableStocksForSale)
        This method views the list of options of stocks available for sale that are received from the controller and prompts the user to input the number of shares that the user wants to sell.
        Parameters:
        listOfAvailableStocksForSale - list of stocks available for sale

      • buyAnotherReset

        void buyAnotherReset()
        This method displays the previous view of buying stock.

      • resetStockSellScreenAfterSell

        void resetStockSellScreenAfterSell()
        This method resets the list of stocks available for sale and the text field.
